displaytitle: Statue of Julius Caesar, Campidoglio, Palazzo Senatorio dei Conservatori, Rome
medium: Pen and brown ink and brush and brown wash over traces of black chalk on tan laid paper
creditline: Gift of Emily Townsend Vermeule, honorary degree holder of the Class of 1989, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule III, in memory of Alphaeus Hyatt Mayor, Class of 1922, George Rodney Meneely, Class of 1933, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule Jr., Class of 1917
inscribed:
Inscribed verso, upper center, in pen and brown ink: Julio
Caesari: Campidoglio

titles.title: Statue of Julius Caesar, Campidoglio, Palazzo Senatorio dei Conservatori, Rome

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1997," in "A Window into Collecting American Folk Art: The Edward Duff Balken Collection at Princeton," special issue, Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 57, no. 1/2 (1998): p. 164-208.
bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1997," in "A Window into Collecting American Folk Art: The Edward Duff Balken Collection at Princeton," special issue, Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 57, no. 1/2 (1998): p. 164-208., pp. 170–171

bibliography.boilertext: Laura Giles, Lia Markey, Claire Van Cleave, et. al., Italian Master Drawings from the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2014).
bibliography.citation: Laura Giles, Lia Markey, Claire Van Cleave, et. al., Italian Master Drawings from the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2014)., p. 277, app. no. 140 (illus.)

exhibitions.citation: Medals to Masters: Drawings and Medals. The Italian Renaissance to Modern America, April 1987 - August 1987

caption: Unknown Italian artist, Statue of Julius Caesar, Campidoglio, Palazzo Senatorio dei Conservatori, Rome, after 1782. Pen and brown ink and brush and brown wash over traces of black chalk on tan laid paper; 27.3 × 20.4 cm. Gift of Emily Townsend Vermeule, honorary degree holder of the Class of 1989, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule III, in memory of Alphaeus Hyatt Mayor, Class of 1922, George Rodney Meneely, Class of 1933, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule Jr., Class of 1917 (1997-62)
